Personal and Research Data Management
Organize, Clean & Enrich

UPPA - ED 481 SSH / Tools for Digital Humanities

Author
Affiliations

Julien Rabaud

Research Library for Applied Mathematics

Pôle Numérique - Research Data Management support

Published

February 9, 2026

Welcome

This website contains all materials for the Personal and Research Data Management: Organize, Clean & Enrich workshop, organized by the UPPA SSH Doctoral School.

NoteWorkshop Information
  • Date: February 9, 2026
  • Duration: 2 hours
  • Format: Online (via Rendez-Vous)
  • Language: English
  • Instructor: Julien Rabaud

Workshop Contents

Main Tools

  • Archifiltre - Visualize and analyze your file organization
  • OpenRefine - Clean and transform messy datasets

Topics Covered

  1. Research data & FAIR principles
  2. File naming conventions and directory structures
  3. Storage and backup strategies (3-2-1 rule)
  4. Hands-on data cleaning exercises

Quick Links

For the Workshop

  • View Slides
  • Download dirty_data.csv
  • Github Repository

Additional Resources

  • File Organization Tools
  • File Naming & Backup Best Practices
  • OpenRefine Tutorials & Videos

Pre-Workshop Preparation

Please complete the following before the workshop:

ImportantRequired Installations
  1. Archifiltre - Download here
  2. OpenRefine - Download here
  3. Sample data -

Technical requirements:

  • Stable internet connection
  • Working camera and microphone (for interaction)
  • A folder with some of your research files (for Archifiltre exploration)

Need Help?

If you encounter any installation issues or have questions, please contact:

Julien Rabaud
julien.rabaud@univ-pau.fr

Workshop Schedule

Time Activity
0:00 - 0:10 Introduction & FAIR Principles
0:10 - 0:30 Archifiltre Demo & Hands-on
0:30 - 0:35 Break
0:35 - 0:55 Storage & Backup Best Practices
0:55 - 1:55 OpenRefine: Data Cleaning Workshop
1:55 - 2:00 Q&A & Wrap-up

Additional Support

After the workshop, you can:

  • Review all materials on this website
  • Consult the additional resources pages
  • Reach out for individual support
